title: George H. Jackson
text:
George H. Jackson (28 February 1863, <a href="Natick">Natick</a> – 19??) was an American lawyer, consul, and political activist. He was appointed treasurer at the founding meeting of the <a href="Niagara%20Movement">Niagara Movement</a>.
He went to the <a href="Congo%20Free%20State">Congo Free State</a> in 1893 where he served as a <a href="medical%20missionary">medical missionary</a> until 1895. 
Jackson was appointed <a href="Consul%20%28representative%29">Consul</a> at <a href="La%20Rochelle">La Rochelle</a>, <a href="France">France</a> in 1898 to 1908 and then <a href="Cognac">Cognac</a> from 1908 to 1914.
In 1919 he was appointed to the <a href="Chicago%20Commission%20on%20Race%20Relations">Chicago Commission on Race Relations</a>.
